inference:
First, we will find $CD$. Since $C$ is the midpoint of $\overline{BD}$, we can use the midpoint formula to find $CD$:
$$CD = \frac{BD}{2} = \frac{BE + ED}{2} = \frac{20 cm + 10 cm}{2} = 15 cm.$$

Next, we will find $AC$. Since $AD$ and $DC$ are congruent and $AD$ = 30 cm, we can use the segment addition postulate to find $AC$:
$$AC = AD + DC = 30 cm + 15 cm = 45 cm.$$

Final Answer: \boxed{$45$}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: We have $AB+BD=30\text{ cm}$, $BD+DE=20\text{ cm}$, and $AB+BD+DE=40\text{ cm}$.  Summing the first two equations and subtracting the third gives $BD=30\text{ cm}+20\text{ cm}-40\text{ cm}=10$ cm.  Therefore, $BC=BD/2=5\text{ cm}$, $AB=AD-BD=20\text{ cm}$, and $AC=AB+BC=5\text{ cm}+20\text{ cm}=\boxed{25}\text{ cm}$.
